seo.title: Metric BMI Calculator - Calculate Your Body Mass Index (kg/cm)
seo.description: Easily calculate your Body Mass Index (BMI) using your weight in kilograms and height in centimeters. Determine your weight status (underweight, normal, overweight, obese) with this simple tool.

faq.question: What is BMI?
faq.answer: BMI stands for Body Mass Index. It is a measure that uses your height and weight to work out if your weight is healthy. It's calculated for adults aged 20 and over.

faq.question: How is BMI calculated using metric units?
faq.answer: BMI is calculated by dividing an individual's weight in kilograms (kg) by the square of their height in meters (m²). For example, if you weigh 70 kg and are 1.75 meters tall (175 cm), your BMI would be 70 / (1.75 * 1.75) = 22.86 kg/m².

faq.question: What are the common BMI categories for adults?
faq.answer: Standard BMI categories are: Underweight (below 18.5), Normal weight (18.5 to 24.9), Overweight (25.0 to 29.9), and Obesity (30.0 and above).

faq.question: Is BMI accurate for everyone?
faq.answer: While BMI is a widely used screening tool, it may not be accurate for certain groups, such as very muscular individuals (who might have a high BMI but low body fat), the elderly, or pregnant women. It should be used as a general guide rather than a definitive diagnosis of health.
